content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

Particle <math alttext="P"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> moves along the <math alttext="y"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="y of t, equals, 4 t minus two thirds"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all times <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A second particle, particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, moves along the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, the fraction with numerator the sine of, open parenthesis, pi t, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 minus t, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all times <math alttext="t is not equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   As time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches 2, what is the limit of the position of particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

Particle <math alttext="P"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> moves along the <math alttext="y"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="y of t, equals, 4 t minus two thirds"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all times <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. A second particle, particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, moves along the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of t equals, the fraction with numerator the sine of, open parenthesis, pi t, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 minus t, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all times <math alttext="t is not equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   As time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches 2, what is the limit of the position of particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

(b)   Show that the velocity of particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="v sub Q, end subscript, of t, equals the fraction with numerator 2 pi, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi t, close parenthesis, minus pi t, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi t, close parenthesis, plus the sine of, open parenthesis, pi t, close parenthesis, and denominator open parenthesis, 2 minus t, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all times <math alttext="t is not equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c)   Find the rate of change of the distance between particle <math alttext="P"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and particle <math alttext="Q"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals one half"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
